The video game Minecraft has sold over 50 million copies since it was first released in 2009, making it one of the most successful and popular games on the entire market. Both adults and children like the gameplay, and since 2011 at the latest, when the game was also available on smartphones and tablets, the game has been a must on every mobile device.

Minecraft popular with elementary school students

Elementary school students in particular are very interested in playing Minecraft. There are many reasons for this. First of all, the game couldn’t be simpler. The simple, angular graphics may not be able to keep up with many other video games at first glance, but it has its own charm. Many children are also happy that the game does not have a fixed goal or a tight scoring system in which you have to compete with other players. It’s all about one thing: creativity. The children can live out their creativity in this game, there are hardly any limits to their fantasies. With the almost infinite selection of blocks implemented in the game, all sorts of different buildings or the like can be built. So the child can build his own little kingdom. The player can set his own goal, especially when it comes to creative projects, which significantly increases the motivation to play. But the adventure instinct in every child is not neglected. You can fight monsters that may seem scary at first, but look almost funny to kids (and parents) upon closer inspection.

The game is very popular among teenagers and elementary school students, so Lego couldn’t escape the hype and offers various creative boxes and construction toys.

Minecraft images

Playing Minecraft on your smartphone is fun! And not only children and young people, elementary school students and high school graduates alike, parents also have great fun with this game. In addition, the game definitely has pedagogical effects that make the children’s parents especially happy. Through play, children can learn how to organize or plan something and at the same time express themselves creatively. This has also been confirmed several times by scientists.

Minecraft Let’s Play

In Let’ Play mode, Youtubers record their games and then put the video online. FlowoTV is the channel of a primary school student who enjoys creative building in Minecraft. In various stories, the viewers are taken into the Minecraft world. Dear parents, if you don’t want to come out as an absolute newbie to your children, you should watch a few episodes. And can show off with words like “crafting”, “cobbling” or “wooden pickaxe”. 😉
